markdownRemark.html:
A few years ago, I got the idea that I should start a blog. I was a software engineer, working at a startup in New York City, and I was learning a ton of exciting things about building software. I promptly bought a domain, cloned a static site generator, published my first post, and patted myself on the back.

I never touched the blog again.

Now that I am a few years older and working as a manager of engineers, I wonder what I would say if I could meet with my former self in a one-on-one. One of my favorite parts of being a manager is working directly with my reports. I love coaching them to reach their goals and follow through on their responsibilities.
